content.description: Decent climbing on dusty holds from all the sand that gets blown around. Beware of people shooting guns nearby...make sure they aren't shooting trash in your direction. Half the time they don't know you are up there.
content.location:
Seventh route from the left:

Zimbabwe - 5.10c

Stotinki - 5.9

World of War - 5.10b TR

Misery - 5.11c

Keep Your Filthy Hands Off My Desert - 5.11b/c

La Tour De Pump - 5.11c

Surface to Air - 5.12a

Finney and Oda Go Bolting - 5.11a

Scud Missile - 5.10d

Home Grown - 5.10a

Bob - 5.8

content.description: Head up the extra chossy rock to the slightly less chossy steeper line above. Pull over a few small roofs on great holds. Trends right.
content.protection: Quickdraws. Bring at least 13. Probably more. Chain anchors.
content.location: Look on the far left side of the north side of Lone Rock before it becomes very broken and vegetated. The route protects with glue-ins.

content.description:
A good warmup, physically and psychologically (i.e. target practice).  Rounded, blocky holds through a few interesting sections eventually yield the chains.

The guidebook says this is the best route on the wall.
content.location:
Approximately where the approach trail ends at the cliff and just to the right.  Look for a high bolt with a footless start.

Or, look for the bolt line just to the right of the 11a which has rusted wedge bolts.
